alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 9:10PM CDT until April 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... St. Croix River AT Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Croix River AT Danbury. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM CDT Thursday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.5 feet on 06/06/1944. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun St. Croix River Danbury 7.0 7.2 Thu 7 pm CDT 7.6 7.4 6.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon by 100 PM CDT.
